Job Title: Perfect Binder Operator I -Weekend Shift

Location: Monroe, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Date Posted: Apr 18, 2024

Company: O'Neil Digital Solutions, LLC

Title: Perfect Binder Operator I -Weekend Shift

About Us

Founded in 1973, O’Neil Digital Solutions (ODS) is a leading IT consulting firm specializing in the optimization of complex end-to-end business process systems for a multitude of business verticals including Financial Services, Digital Media, Healthcare, and Transportation industries. ODS provides high-touch bespoke software engineering, systems integration, and infrastructure management services to clients of all sizes and industries. From large scale mass communication projects to highly secure and confidential data analytics using Big Data frameworks like Hadoop and AWS Redshift, ODS has a broad set of proven technical capabilities that help companies make complex digital transformations. ODS offers state of the art publishing solutions through our customer-centric applications and services include electronic document delivery, web applications, high-speed digital printing (color and black & white), automated composition, offset printing, warehousing and fulfillment services. ODS is headquartered in Los Angeles, CA and also has offices/plants in Texas and North Carolina centrally located to serve clients across the country.

Summary

The Perfect Binder Operator I operates and maintains the Kolbus Binder that produces various printed materials. The operator is responsible for operation of the binder as well as the maintenance, troubleshooting and repairs.

Duties And Responsibilities

Responsbile for the efficient make-ready and operation of machineContinuous review of job ticket specifications to meet customer and productivity commitmentsAdjusting and maintaining gluing units, trimmer and milling stationsOperate equipment in a safe manner including adhering to established company guidelinesMaintains equipment, troubleshoots equipment problems, performs prescribed preventative maintenance on equipment as required and identify repairs if neededMakes adjustments as required to return output to the proper specificationsAccepts and receives supervision and assistance with regard to machine setupInspect and evaluate reject sheets, signatures and/or wasteMaintains the work area and equipment in a clean orderly conditionProperly change consumablesSet-up the cover feederAdjust cameras and scanner as neededCommunicates status of jobs to department managerPerform other duties as assigned

Qualifications & Requirements

High School graduate, or completion of GED requiredA minimum of two years’ experience in a Bindery environment (operating either Harris, Kolbus, Muller Martini Perfect Binding Equipment)Mechnical ability to effectively perform equipment operation and general maintenancePerform all work and activities with honesty and integrityTake personal responsibility for productivity, quality and timeliness of workEffectively communicate (and listen) clearly, professionally, politely and persuasively in all situations; respond well and in a reasonable, timely mannerChallenge conventional practices and use creativity and information to lead, innovate, problem solve, and implement ideas to contribute to the growth of the organizationSupport and meet company/department goals and core valuesCollaborate with co-workers to achieve common goals

Working Conditions

Must be able to perform the essential job duties. Work may be performed in an office, warehouse and/or manufacturing environment. Requires the ability to perform the following activities for the majority of the day: stand for extended periods of time, walk, bend, stoop, kneel, crouch or climb. In addition requires the ability to lift and/or push up to 50 pounds. May be exposed to noise and be required to wear hearing protection for the duration of the shift.

Equal Opportunity Employer

O'Neil Digital Solutions is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
